About Me

Hi, I’m Francisco Cantos and also a senior iOS applications developer. I have worked at a number of companies gaining teamwork and multiple skills.

I am a very restless person who always likes to learn new things. When I master a subject I like to share it with anyone who wants to learn. At work I am always willing to help my colleagues in everything they need.

I am passionate about technological advances and I like to try everything. I get informed about these advances in several RSS, social networks and newsletters.

Experience

Storybeat

Senior iOS Developer

February 2022 - Present

www.storybeat.com

Storybeat is a content editing app to share on social networks oriented to influencers.

I started my path in Storybeat because I was looking for a bigger challenge than the ones already had and the experience has been exciting.

During this time I have performed tasks such as analysis and development of new features with the product team, testing with XCTests, redesign of screens, queries to REST-APIs using URLSession, manages purchases and subscriptions in App-Store, translations with Lokalise, uploads to the App-Store, make error analysis with Crashlitics, check analytics with Firebase, Xcode-Cloud implementation, use the AppleMusic API, deliver remote and local notifications, use of UserDefaults, audio and video editing with AVFundation, ads integration with Google AdMob… All this using a Redux architecture (Unidirectional Data Flow) with the ReSwift framework. We also use tools like Swiftlint, Periphery, Cocoapods, SPM, Figma, Purchasely, Firebase, Google-SignIn, Kingfisher, Lottie, SwiftGen, Lottie…

The atmosphere with my teammates is great and this is very important when you are remote. We have our own Kanban and we get along great with Jira and Github. The review of PRs was extensive among teammates of the same platform and this greatly improved the quality of the code and avoided errors. Also in each release we have to do like Quality Assurance to check in our own hands the quality of the development. Every month we took turns to be in charge of online teambuildings and the organization of retrospective meetings to know the status of the team members and introduce improvements according to the whole team.

We also had the opportunity to contribute to the Roadmap of the app.

Vodafone

Senior iOS Developer

March 2020 - February 2022

www.vodafone.es

MyVodafone app is designed for Vodafone customers to manage their services more easily and conveniently through their mobile devices.

During this stage I was in 2 different companies; in my first stage I was hired through the company Alten and after 9 months I had a change of supplier to Qaracter.

At Vodafone I started right at the beginning of the pandemic; it was my first contact with 100% remote work. There I was part of the Transactional team where we developed different functionalities to facilitate the process of acquiring discounts by the customer.

The app is developed in Swift code, with an MVP architecture. For error control and code quality control, unit tests are performed with XCTest. We use tools such as SwiftLint, Kiuwan and SonarQube to increase code quality. Task management was done with Jira using Scrum methodology in 3-week sprints. Between the different teams we reviewed each other’s PRs to test that everything was OK.

INNOCV Solutions

Mid iOS Developer

April 2019 - February 2022

www.innocv.com

At INNOCV I had the opportunity to participate in the development of the EVOBank app for its users where they can manage the services offered by the bank.

The development of this app I used reactive programming using the RXSwift framework and a VIPER architecture. Unit tests were performed with XCTEst and also we used SonarQube and Swiftlint to increase code quality. The task management was performed with Azure and Scrum as agile methodology. The app was separated into different frameworks that contained the different logics to improve compilation and testing times.

The developers were divided into 3 teams of 3 people; 2 teams from InnoCV and one from another company, who managed their own tasks and responsibilities. The PRs were reviewed among the different team members. Also in each team we had a QA to improve the quality of the product.

Movilok

Junior iOS Developer

January 2016 - March 2019

www.movilok.net

At Movilok I worked on the BBVA bank app for business users, BBVA NetCash. It was my first contact with an organized architecture and work methodology.

Working at Movilok was a big change for me, it was the company where I became more professional. There I learned about apps architectures like VIPER, I learned Apple’s new programming language, Swift; I learned about agile methodologies like Scrum, I learned to work with an important client like BBVA and to expose the new functionalities we had developed.

Trecone Solutions

Junior iOS Developer

October 2014 - December 2015

www.trecone.com

Trecone was the company that gave me my first opportunity to work as an iOS developer. Here I Worked on two products: Treconite; an app for calls and data consumption control in an iPhone; and Promedio, an app for the Extremadura regional government.

We were a small team without experience, without a working methodology, without testing and without a defined architecture in the apps. These apps were made in Objective-C

Education

Polytechnic University of Valencia (UPV)

Master in mobile applications development

2015 - 2017

In this master I gained knowledge about the entire field of application development for mobile devices. Among the subjects were iOS development, Android development, Android for wereables, Android auto, Unity 3D, Webapps, PWA, WindowsPhone and business models in applications.

University of Extremadura (UEX)

Technical Engineering in Computer Systems

2005 - 2014

In this career I learned all the basic and broad knowledge of technical informatics. What I value most from this training was the knowledge about programming, which has laid the foundation for my professional career.

When I'm Not Programming

I’m always very interested in technology, I like to read articles and learn about anything, AI, architectures, new devices, new methodologies, new apps, business…

In my day to day, after work I like to do sports like crossfit, biking, climbing, running…

Of course I also like to go to eat in new places and discover food from other countries. I also like to cook and I have mastered rice dishes and Neapolitan pizzas; my cheesecakes are AWESOME!
